meta.title: Operation of Manual Capsule Filling Machine

sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Manual Capsule Filling Machine for small-scale filling of powder formulations into hard gelatin capsules.
sections.scope: Applicable to manual capsule filling activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the capsule filling machine is placed on a clean, stable work surface.
Verify that all parts including plates, pins, and tamping tools are clean and dry.
Select appropriate capsule size for the formulation.
Check empty capsules for defects and discard any damaged ones.
Place empty capsules into the loading tray with proper orientation.
Insert loaded tray into the machine base.
Lower the separation plate to separate capsule caps from bodies.
Remove the tray with capsule caps and set aside.
Spread powder formulation evenly over the tray with capsule bodies.
Use tamping tool to compact powder into capsule bodies.
Scrape excess powder and repeat tamping if needed to achieve target fill weight.
Remove excess powder from tray surface.
Place the tray with capsule caps over the filled bodies.
Press down gently to join caps and bodies.
Lift the joining plate to eject filled capsules.
Collect filled capsules and inspect for proper closure.
Weigh sample capsules to verify fill weight uniformity.
Segregate any defective or improperly filled capsules.
Clean all parts of the machine thoroughly after use.
Document fill weights, capsule size, and observations in the batch record.
precautions: Handle empty capsules carefully to prevent breakage.
Use powder with good flow properties for uniform filling.
Control humidity to prevent capsule brittleness or softness.
Tamp powder uniformly to avoid weight variation.
Check fill weight regularly to ensure uniformity.
Inspect capsules for proper closure after filling.
Clean equipment thoroughly between different products.
Wear appropriate PPE including gloves and mask.
Store filled capsules properly to maintain quality.
